name: Sonechard, General of Orcus
immunities: lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Giant, Goblin, Ignan, Infernal, Terran; telepathy 120 ft.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Sonechard carries the war pick Fool’s Errand.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Sonechard can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.desc: Sonechard’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no material components. * At will: animate dead, chill touch (17th level), inflict wounds (5th level) * 3/day each: circle of death, create undead, fireball, finger of death, harm * 1/day: create undead (9th level)

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
traits.desc: If Sonechard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Sonechard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of Sonechard must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to Sonechard’s Stench for 24 hours.

traits.name: Unholy Aura
traits.desc: An unholy aura surrounds Sonechard out to a radius of 40 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is frightened for 1 minute. While frightened, it is paralyzed. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

traits.name: Undead Master
traits.desc: When Sonechard casts animate dead or create undead, it creates twice the amount of undead with each casting.

traits.name: Undead Walking
traits.desc: Slain creatures sometimes rise as skeletons or zombies, abhorred mockeries of their former states.

traits.name: Nightmares
traits.desc: Unpleasant dreams wrack those who rest within 6 miles of Sonechard’s lair. If Sonechard dies, the effects fade immediately, but animated undead remain until destroyed. # Fool's Errand Weapon (war pick), artifact (requires attunement) Fool’s Errand is a macabre spectacle, wrought of a dark, unknown wood as hard as steel. The spike of the war pick is similarly unfinished and unpolished and glows dimly with dark energies. Blood and ichor constantly drip from the pick and seems to freeze and thaw continuously no matter what attempts are made to clean the weapon.

traits.name: Attunement
traits.desc: To attune to Fools’ Errand, you must slay a celestial being of lawful good alignment.

traits.name: Magic Weapon
traits.desc: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with Fool’s Errand. It also functions as a sword of wounding.

traits.name: Unholy Smite
traits.desc: When you hit with Fools’ Errand, you deal an additional 3d6 necrotic damage on a hit, and a creature who takes this damage is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells and other effects, and you have advantage on attack rolls with Fool’s Errand.

traits.name: The Smell of Blood
traits.desc: While holding Fool’s Errand, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice hidden creatures.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc: Fool’s Errand has 20 charges. You can use an action to cast one of the following spells using those charges: bestow curse (3 charges), blight (4 charges), circle of death (6 charges), or finger of death (7 charges). If you expend the last charge, you take 4d6 necrotic damage and regain a number of charges equal to the damage dealt, up to a maximum of 20. This damage cannot drop you below 1 hit point. Fool’s Errand recovers all lost charges each day at midnight.

traits.name: Destruction
traits.desc: Fool’s Errand can only be destroyed by the ancient celestial Sonechard first killed to attune to the weapon. This creature must bath it in a holy water font specially crafted and blessed for the purpose.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Sonechard makes two attacks with Fool’s Errand, one claw attack, and one head butt, or two claw attacks and one head butt.

actions.name: Fool’s Errand
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Head Butt
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Control Undead
actions.desc: Sonechard chooses one undead creature not already under its control that it can see within 120 feet of it. That creature, or the creature that controls it, must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the undead falls under Sonechard’s control and obeys its every command.

actions.name: Command Undead
actions.desc: Sonechard gives telepathic commands to any undead it controls unless they are on another plane of existence. It can command them to take specific actions, such as “attack those creatures” or general instructions “guard this passageway.”

actions.name: Heal Undead
actions.desc: Sonechard sends necrotic energy coursing through his lair. Up to six undead under his command regain 19 (4d6 + 5) hit points each. Sonechard does not need to see these undead in order to grant them this boon.

actions.name: Raise Dead
actions.desc: Sonechard chooses one slain creature and causes the creature’s soul to rise as a specter under its control.

actions.name: Fearsome Show
actions.desc: Sonechard causes the many corpses within its lair to animate briefly and babble the horrific tales of their deaths. Creatures within its lair that are not constructs or undead must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, those creatures are frightened for 1 minute. While frightened, those creatures must attempt to flee the lair, Dashing where possible. If a creature is trapped or cannot move, they can take the Dodge action instead. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If the saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, that creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

actions.name: Undead Awareness
actions.desc: Whenever an undead is created or enters within 1 mile of Sonechard’s lair, Sonechard is aware of the creature’s presence and location.

legendary.name: Head butt
legendary.desc: Sonechard uses its head butt attack.

legendary.name: Command Undead
legendary.desc: Sonechard can command one undead Sonechard controls to use its reaction to move its speed, or make a melee or ranged attack.

legendary.name: Animate Dead (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.desc: Sonechard animates one corpse within 120 feet of it as a zombie.
